translation:
Friend and Lord Almeida, São Lourenço, April 20, 1845.

That Your Mercy São Gabriel at Cristal, that the liquidation commission ended on May 8, and that all documents that were legalized would be paid, and for which there was no limited amount; likewise that such documents to be properly legalized depend on the signature of one of the generals, or the chief.

Therefore, the two I sent through Your Mercy Viana, having Your Mercy Viana taken them, I would have them initialed here by Bento, and send them by the same person who should leave from there on the 26th of the current month; finally rendering ineffective the two documents that the same Viana already took, once what I pass above to you is verified.

Thus, I also ask you to tell me something if you know anything about such collection. We commend ourselves to your family; and to Your Mercy.

Your friend and obliged servant, Antônio Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Postscript: Viana took documents from Your Mercy, one on March 15, 1835 — Amount of the yacht: 4:000$000
Same on October 12, 1836 — Same of 5 slaves from the Jaguarão farm: José, field hand — 800$000
Joaquim, said — 700$000
Alberto, said — 600$000
Pedro, said — 700$000
Fermiano — 800$000

São Lourenço, April 20, 1845. Received June 24, 1845. Responded June 27, 1845.
